skill.name: firefox-browser
skill.description: Control the user's Firefox browser with their logins and cookies intact. Use when you need to browse websites as the user, interact with authenticated pages, fill forms, click buttons, take screenshots, or get page content. (user)
skill.summary: Control the user's Firefox browser with their logins and cookies intact. Use when you need to browse...
skill.author: 1jehuang

security_audit.summary: This is a SKILL.md configuration/prompt file for a Firefox Browser Agent Bridge. The skill uses a documented WebSocket architecture to communicate with a Firefox extension. It provides browser automation capabilities as described. No executable code, obfuscation, or malicious patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Users need to automate browser tasks while keeping their logged-in sessions. This skill bridges AI agents to real Firefox browsers via WebSocket, preserving cookies and authentication.
actual_capabilities: List open tabs and navigate between them
Get page content in text, HTML, or annotated format
Click buttons, links, and interactive elements
Fill forms with text inputs, textareas, and select dropdowns
Take screenshots of visible page areas
Handle authentication using existing browser sessions
limitations: Requires Firefox browser and the agent bridge extension installed
WebSocket connection must be running to communicate with Firefox
Cannot access browser profiles other than the default profile
Limited to single browser instance control

use_cases.title: Automated testing with login
use_cases.description: Test web applications through authenticated flows using real browser sessions

use_cases.title: Form submission testing
use_cases.description: Automate form filling and validation on staging environments with real credentials

use_cases.title: Natural language browsing
use_cases.description: Control your browser using plain language commands without manual navigation

prompt_templates.title: List open tabs
prompt_templates.scenario: Check what browser tabs are open

prompt_templates.title: Navigate and read
prompt_templates.scenario: Visit a URL and get page content

output_examples.input: List open tabs and navigate to example.com
output: Page content retrieved with interactive elements marked

best_practices: Start fresh with newSession for isolated automation tasks
Use annotated format for getContent to see clickable elements in context
Specify tabId explicitly when running parallel tasks
Verify page content with getContent after navigation before interacting
anti_patterns: Running parallel tasks without isolating to separate tabs
Assuming page elements exist without first checking getContent output
Automating sensitive actions without user verification
Leaving the browser bridge running unattended for extended periods

faq.question: What browsers are supported?
faq.answer: Only Firefox is supported. The skill requires the Firefox agent bridge extension to be installed.

faq.question: What are the rate limits?
faq.answer: No strict limits exist but commands execute at human speed. Rapid commands may be throttled by the browser.

faq.question: How do I integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: The skill works with Bash, Read, and Write tools. Chain commands for complex workflows. Use tabId for isolation.

faq.question: Is my browsing data safe?
faq.answer: The bridge connects to your local Firefox instance. Data stays on your machine. Review extension permissions before installing.

faq.question: Connection refused errors?
faq.answer: Check Firefox is running and the extension is loaded. Reload the extension in about:debugging if needed.

faq.question: How is this different from Playwright or Puppeteer?
faq.answer: This uses your real Firefox profile with existing logins and cookies. No separate browser launch or profile setup required.
